title: CPI Was A Non-Event For USD: Watch These Levels
text:
US for September was 0.0% vs 0.1% expected and 0.1% last. However the more important was 2.4%, as expected, and 2.4% last. Core CPI is the measure of CPI ex-food and ex-energy. This is one of the Fed’s key measures of inflation, which remains above its 2.0% inflation target. As the Minutes from the September meeting have shown, the Fed was slightly more hawkish in its latest assessment. However, since that meeting, and data have come out worse than expected. The Fed needs to see if these leading indicators feed through to the rest of the economy, which is why its remains data dependent.

Upon release of the data, the was trading near the lows of the day at 98.75 as speculation swirls regarding the US-China trade discussions. The USD has been in an upward channel since May 2018. However, since September 13, the Dollar Index has been forming a rising wedge within that longer-term channel. On Thursday, price broke lower out of that that wedge. The target for the breakdown of a rising wedge is a 100% retracement. However price has held strong horizontal support at the 50% retracement of the wedge, which is 98.76.

Daily USD

Source: Tradingview, FOREX.com

On the 240-minute chart, USD is putting in a flag formation. After moving lower from the highs of 99.67, price moved to the horizontal support at 98.76, and then bounced. As the dollar broke lower on Thursday out of the rising wedge, it also broke out of the flag and is once again testing that horizontal support area. The target for the breakout of a flag is the length of the flagpole added to the high before the breakout of the flag formation, which in this case is 98.15.

4-Hour USD

Source: Tradingview, FOREX.com

If the Dollar Index can close below the 98.76 horizontal level, probabilities increase that price will aim for the flag target level at 98.15 – as well as the target level of the ascending wedge at 97.84. If we reach those targets, watch for a move to test the upward sloping trendline near 97.00. Horizontal resistance is above Wednesday’s spike-lows at 98.90. From there, USD can shoot all the way to previous highs at 99.67 if patterns fail.

Of course as we have been mentioning all week, keep an eye out for headlines and tweets regarding the China-US trade talks.
description: Forex Analysis by Joe Perry covering: US Dollar Index Futures. Read Joe Perry's latest article on Investing.com
